Detailed Description

mgSysGL is a class to provide a facility to draw temporal pictures.

MGOpenGLView holds a list of mgSysGL and draws the pictures by invoking display list drawer. As long as the codes are unique, function codes can be any numbers. Usually the id is a command id.

Member Function Documentation

virtual mgSysGL* mgSysGL::clone (  )  const [virtual]

Construct new object by copying to newed area.

User must delete this copied object by "delete".

Reimplemented in mgSysZebraGL.

virtual void mgSysGL::draw ( MGOpenGLView &  glv  )  const [inline, virtual]

Draw this Sysgl.

This draw is used to draw the pictures for Undo(, Redo) operations. When this draw is invoked, all of the functions of mgGDL can be used in that context.

Reimplemented in mgSysZebraGL.

virtual bool mgSysGL::includes ( const MGGel *  gel  )  const [virtual]

Test if this mgSysGL includes gel(return true) or not.

The default includes tests if the input gel is m_gel of this member data.

Reimplemented in mgSys2GL.

void mgSysGL::make_display_list ( MGOpenGLView &  glv  ) 

Make system display list in glv.

This must be a newed object and the ownership will be transfered to glv(glv.m_sysgllist).
